item.title: Alison add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Do you think I am an automaton? — a machine without feelings? and can bear to have my morsel of bread snatched from my lips, and my drop of living water dashed from my cup? Do you think, because I am poor, obscure, plain, and little, I am soulless and heartless? You think wrong! — I have as much soul as you — and full as much heart! And if God had gifted me with some beauty and much wealth, I should have made it as hard for you to leave me, as it is now for me to leave you. I am not talking to you now through the medium of custom, conventionalities, nor even of mortal flesh: it is my spirit that addresses your spirit; just as if both had passed through the grave, and we stood at God's feet, equal — as we are!" -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Alison add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "I suppose sooner or later in the life of everyone comes a moment of trial. We all of us have our particular devil who rides us and torments us, and we must give battle in the end." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Alison add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Alison add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "My meaning simply is, that whatever I have tried to do in life, I have tried with all my heart to do well; that whatever I have devoted myself to, I have devoted myself to completely; that in great aims and in small, I have always been thoroughly in earnest." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Alison add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Alison add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Sentimental music has this great way of taking you back somewhere at the same time that it takes you forward, so you feel nostagic and hopeful all at the same time." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Alison add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Nothing is yet in its true form." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Alison add a quote by Jonathan Tropper
item.description: "We all start out so damn sure, thinking we've got the world on a string. If we ever stopped to think about the infinite number of ways we could be undone, we'd never leave our bedrooms." -- Jonathan Tropper

item.title: Alison add a quote by Jonathan Tropper
item.description: "...the first thing you do at the end is reflect on the beginning. Maybe it's some form of reverse closure, or just the basic human impulse toward sentimentality, or masochism, but as you stand there shell-shocked in the charred ruins of your life, your mind will invariably go back to the time when it all started. And even if you didn't fall in love in the eighties, in your mind it will fee like the eighties, all innocent and airbrushed, with bright colors and shoulder pads and Pat Benatar or The Cure on the soundtrack." -- Jonathan Tropper

item.title: Alison add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It's all nonsense. It's only nonsense. I'm not afraid of the rain. I am not afraid of the rain. Oh, oh, God, I wish I wasn't." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Alison add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I may not be as stong as I think, but I know many tricks and I have resolution." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Alison add a quote by Sherwood Anderson
item.description: "Only the few know the sweetness of the twisted apples." -- Sherwood Anderson

item.title: Alison add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Alison add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Lesson learned? When people say, "You really, really must" do something, it means you don't really have to. No one ever says, "You really, really must deliver the baby during labor." When it's true, it doesn't need to be said." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Alison add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Whitney Houston’s cover of “I Will Always Love You” was constantly on my FM Walkman radio around that time. I think that made me cry because I associated it with absolutely no one." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Alison add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "You can’t be that kid standing at the top of the waterslide, overthinking it. You have to go down the chute." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Alison add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Alison add a quote by Carlos Fuentes
item.description: "I need, therefore I imagine." -- Carlos Fuentes

item.title: Alison add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft
item.description: "The beginning is always today." -- Mary Wollstonecraft

item.title: Alison add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Men can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as they can from a lack of bread." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Alison add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "And how have I lived? Frankly and openly, though crudely. I have not been afraid of life. I have not shrunk from it. I have taken it for what it was at its own valuation. And I have not been ashamed of it. Just as it was, it was mine." -- Jack London

item.title: Alison add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Alison add a quote by Dashiell Hammett
item.description: "He felt like somebody had taken the lid off life and let him see the works." -- Dashiell Hammett

item.title: Alison add a quote by Jonathan Swift
item.description: "May you live every day of your life." -- Jonathan Swift

item.title: Alison add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I believe that today more than ever a book should be sought after even if it has only one great page in it. We must search for fragments, splinters, toenails, anything that has ore in it, anything that is capable of resuscitating the body and the soul." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Alison add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I need to be alone. I need to ponder my shame and my despair in seclusion; I need the sunshine and the paving stones of the streets without companions, without conversation, face to face with myself, with only the music of my heart for company." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Alison add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "Life always has an unhappy ending, but you can have a lot of fun along the way, and everything doesn't have to be dripping in deep significance." -- Roger Ebert

item.title: Alison add a quote by Roger Ebert
item.description: "We are put on this planet only once, and to limit ourselves to the familiar is a crime against our minds." -- Roger Ebert

item.title: Alison add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alison add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison
